author: IanKemp
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
> Import-Module WebAdministration
```

# Expected behavior

The module load fails with an appropriate error message stating why it cannot be loaded.

# Actual behavior

Does not load the module, with a cryptic error message:

```none
Get-PSSession: The remote session with the name WinPSCompatSession  is not available.
```

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-rc.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-rc.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: IanKemp
comments.body: @iSazonov my issue was not with the failure to load the module, rather that the error message doesn't make much sense. I've updated the title and description to reflect this, as such I'd appreciate if you'd reopen.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: /cc @anmenaga Could you please look the issue?

title: "Import-Module WebAdministration" fails with cryptic error
